result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Parrion S Griffin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Parrion S Griffin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court appointed Tom Harris as counsel of record. Case is adjourned.

***
Recalled at 2:34 PM. Attorney Tom Harris appears, other appearances remain the same. Defense needs discovery and an offer. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 2nd, 2022

Defendant Parrion S Griffin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expenses paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Thomas Harris to represent defendant at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $45.00 PER WEEK. Repayment to begin October 27th, 2022. Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Parrion S Griffin
Current: 2422 N Sherman Blvd, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 08-22-2022)
Prior: 6147 North 35Th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 08-20-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Parrion S Griffin in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/18/2022@2:30p
